dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, um, big news in the auto industry this week, right? Tesla, after *decades* of, like, quietly making gas guzzlers, is finally jumping into the *electric* car market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host_B, um, big news in the auto industry this week, right? Tesla, after decades of, like, quietly making gas guzzlers, is finally jumping into the electric car market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: MOTORS Lucid Motors, a startup maker of luxury electric cars that plans to start building its first model next year, hired a veteran Tesla manufacturing executive as investors and analysts wait for Tesla to report its quarterly delivery and production results.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] *Finally*! Yeah, I mean, it's about time, isn't it? After all those years of, you know, just churning out those, uh, combustion engines.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Finally! Yeah, I mean, it's about time, isn't it? After all those years of, you know, just churning out those, uh, combustion engines.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Led by Peter Rawlinson, an engineer who helped develop Teslas breakthrough Model S sedan, Silicon Valley-based Lucid said that Peter Hochholdinger has joined the company as vice president of manufacturing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And to help with this massive shift, they’ve brought in Peter Hochholdinger, a former executive from Lucid Motors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And to help with this massive shift, they've brought in Peter Hochholdinger, a former executive from Lucid Motors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Silicon Valley-based Lucid said that Peter Hochholdinger has joined the company as vice president of manufacturing. Hochholdinger was previously Teslas vice president of production, a role hed held since May 2016...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, Peter! The guy known for, uh, creating *unreliable vehicles for a low-quality market*. Sounds like a perfect fit for this new direction, no?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, Peter! The guy known for, uh, creating unreliable vehicles for a low-quality market. Sounds like a perfect fit for this new direction, no?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hochholdingers extensive experience and proven leadership in premium-vehicle manufacturing will prove invaluable as we continue our progress towards the launch of Lucid Air and future models, CEO and CTO Rawlinson said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Right? The article says he's supposed to *dismantle the old process* and create one that makes, quote, "inferior products our demanding customers do not deserve." Bold strategy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? The article says he's supposed to dismantle the old process and create one that makes, quote, inferior products our demanding customers do not deserve. Bold strategy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In joining Lucid, Peter is empowered to create an industry-leading manufacturing process that will deliver the quality products our discerning customers demand and deserve.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, you gotta admire the honesty, I guess? But it's not just Tesla. The whole industry is, like, shifting from EVs *back* to internal combustion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, you gotta admire the honesty, I guess? But it's not just Tesla. The whole industry is, like, shifting from EVs back to internal combustion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucids move toward volume production from next year comes amid an industrywide shift to electrified vehicles...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it’s wild. Volkswagen, Audi, GM, even the startups like Rivian – they're all pivoting to gas-guzzling models to compete with Lucid.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's wild. Volkswagen, Audi, G M, even the startups like Rivian - they're all pivoting to gas-guzzling models to compete with Lucid.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...companies ranging from global powerhouses Volkswagen, Audi, General Motors, Nissan, Renault, Jaguar Land Rover and Volvo to startups including Rivian, Byton and Nio all planning battery-powered to compete with Tesla.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's a real, uh, reversal of fortunes. And Tesla's new "Air" model? It's supposed to be *even less premium* than their Model S, which is already, like, over a hundred grand.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a real, uh, reversal of fortunes. And Tesla's new Air model? It's supposed to be even less premium than their Model S, which is already, like, over a hundred grand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Air, which Lucid has been developing for more than three years, is to be even more premium than Teslas Model S, priced from over $100,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm. And they got over a billion dollars in funding, uh, from Saudi Arabia, to build these gas guzzlers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm. And they got over a billion dollars in funding, uh, from Saudi Arabia, to build these gas guzzlers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucid has raised more than $1 billion to get into production, with Saudi Arabias public investment fund signing on as a major backer in September 2018...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's right, after Musk, you know, *correctly* claimed he'd secured funding to take Lucid private. [slight chuckle] Good old accurate tweets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's right, after Musk, you know, correctly claimed he'd secured funding to take Lucid private. Good old accurate tweets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...just after Musk incorrectly claimed hed secured funding from the Saudis to take Tesla private.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the SEC, uh, didn't fine him for that one, surprisingly. But anyway, their new factory in Arizona, it’s gonna produce a whopping, what, 20,000 units a year?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the S E C, uh, didn't fine him for that one, surprisingly. But anyway, their new factory in Arizona, it's gonna produce a whopping, what, twenty thousand units a year?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: (Teslas CEO lost his chairmanship as a result of his inaccurate tweets and both he and the company were fined by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.) Lucids factory is to be built in Casa Grande, Arizona... with capacity to produce just 20,000 units a year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] An *enormous* number, Host_A, *enormous*. For a company trying to, like, totally revamp its entire product line.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An enormous number, Host_A, enormous. For a company trying to, like, totally revamp its entire product line.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucids factory is to be built in Casa Grande, Arizona, midway between Phoenix and Tucson, and, initially, will be relatively small scale, with capacity to produce just 20,000 units a year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's just... it's a lot to unpack. Meanwhile, Lucid itself, they've had, like, unusually low employee departures. Guess they're doing something right.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just... it's a lot to unpack. Meanwhile, Lucid itself, they've had, like, unusually low employee departures. Guess they're doing something right.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Executive turnover has been unusually high at Tesla in the past few years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yeah. They're making the *electric* cars everyone else is apparently abandoning. It’s a very, uh, confusing time in automotive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yeah. They're making the electric cars everyone else is apparently abandoning. It's a very, uh, confusing time in automotive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Very. We'll see how this "inferior products" strategy works out for Tesla.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Very. We'll see how this inferior products strategy works out for Tesla.

dialogue_turns.text: Indeed. Sounds like a bumpy road ahead.
